article:
I had a quarrel with my drunken husband and left home with my little daughters. Not knowing where to   _   for the night, I called 911 for help. The officer came up and 42 _  a shelter center for us for the night. However, when we got there, we had to leave as it was too crowded to find a bed.   _  , the woman at the center helped us find a hotel which would   _   us up for three free nights.
On our way to the hotel, the driver, who was an African American, was very   _   and easygoing.   _   my experience, she expressed her   _  . When asked if I had any money, I told her I wasn't allowed to bring my   _  .
When passing a grocery store, she went in and came out with a bag full of groceries, and told me that the food and milk was for the girls and me to eat over the next three days. I don't 49 _  a time in my life when I ever felt more   _  . She comforted me and the 51 _  in her eyes was like an angel.
At 2:00 am the telephone in our room rang. I was told to 52 _  a suitcase in the lobby  . The hotel clerk, who stood there holding a suitcase, told me that an African American woman had   _   it off about thirty minutes ago and wanted to be sure I   _   it.
I unzipped the suitcase and found a   _   that read, "I came back home tonight and   went around   to all of my friends and neighbors   _   goods for you and your children. God bless you!"
I never got the   _   to see or meet her again, and I didn't even know her name. But to this day, I still call her my guardian angel. How lucky and   _   I was to have met someone with such a loving and   _   heart.
